        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->DETAILS<!----></span><br>I found the following PoC during fuzzing. It leads to a DCHECK in a v8 binary compiled with DCHECKS enabled.<span class="line"><!---->I found the following PoC during fuzzing. It leads to a DCHECK in a v8 binary compiled with DCHECKS enabled.<!----></span><br>Since I assume that this is not a security bug I removed the security-tag (I hope I did this correctly).<span class="line"><!---->Since I assume that this is not a security bug I removed the security-tag (I hope I did this correctly).<!----></span><br><br>I would also have another question:<span class="line"><!---->I would also have another question:<!----></span><br>I found during fuzzing three other bugs, however, I couldn't reproduce them in the current v8 9.3.0 - they just affect v8 9.1.269.28 (which is the v8 version used in Chrome 91.0.4472.77).<span class="line"><!---->I found during fuzzing three other bugs, however, I couldn't reproduce them in the current v8 9.3.0 - they just affect v8 9.1.269.28 (which is the v8 version used in Chrome 91.0.4472.77).<!----></span><br>One of them is a "double free detected in tcache" / "double free or corruption", another one is a "abort: 32 bit value in register is not zero-extended" and the third is just a crash with a stack trace. Should I also report these bugs, although I can't reproduce them in the current v8 version? If yes, in just 1 bug report or in 3 bug reports? I'm especially asking because I would release a blog post with the PoCs in some months.<span class="line"><!---->One of them is a "double free detected in tcache" / "double free or corruption", another one is a "abort: 32 bit value in register is not zero-extended" and the third is just a crash with a stack trace. Should I also report these bugs, although I can't reproduce them in the current v8 version? If yes, in just 1 bug report or in 3 bug reports? I'm especially asking because I would release a blog post with the PoCs in some months.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>I confirmed the DCHECK in v8 version 9.3.0 (git hash: <span class="line"><!---->I confirmed the DCHECK in v8 version 9.3.0 (git hash: <!----></span>d0c0d4c36b24183f65cedcc0c6dd5974fb0634af<a class="undefined" target="_blank" This is a different bug to the above one and this PoC just works in v8 9.1.269.28 (and not in  9.3.0), but I don't know if it was fixed yet or if just the PoC must slightly be adapted. demonstrates that it's possible to corrupt heap meta data.<span class="line"><!---->Which demonstrates that it's possible to corrupt heap meta data.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

        <h3 class="medium-heading">Create new hotlist</h3>

          <label for="newHotlistName">New hotlist name:</label>
          <input type="text" name="newHotlistName">
        </div>
        
      <br>
      
    
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button class="de-emphasized discard-button">
            Discard
          </chops-button>
          <chops-button class="emphasized">
            Save changes
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </form>
    
    </chops-dialog>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {

        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

      DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->DETAILS<!----></span><br>I found the following PoC during fuzzing. It leads to a DCHECK in a v8 binary compiled with DCHECKS enabled.<span class="line"><!---->I found the following PoC during fuzzing. It leads to a DCHECK in a v8 binary compiled with DCHECKS enabled.<!----></span><br>Since I assume that this is not a security bug I removed the security-tag (I hope I did this correctly).<span class="line"><!---->Since I assume that this is not a security bug I removed the security-tag (I hope I did this correctly).<!----></span><br><br>I would also have another question:<span class="line"><!---->I would also have another question:<!----></span><br>I found during fuzzing three other bugs, however, I couldn't reproduce them in the current v8 9.3.0 - they just affect v8 9.1.269.28 (which is the v8 version used in Chrome 91.0.4472.77).<span class="line"><!---->I found during fuzzing three other bugs, however, I couldn't reproduce them in the current v8 9.3.0 - they just affect v8 9.1.269.28 (which is the v8 version used in Chrome 91.0.4472.77).<!----></span><br>One of them is a "double free detected in tcache" / "double free or corruption", another one is a "abort: 32 bit value in register is not zero-extended" and the third is just a crash with a stack trace. Should I also report these bugs, although I can't reproduce them in the current v8 version? If yes, in just 1 bug report or in 3 bug reports? I'm especially asking because I would release a blog post with the PoCs in some months.<span class="line"><!---->One of them is a "double free detected in tcache" / "double free or corruption", another one is a "abort: 32 bit value in register is not zero-extended" and the third is just a crash with a stack trace. Should I also report these bugs, although I can't reproduce them in the current v8 version? If yes, in just 1 bug report or in 3 bug reports? I'm especially asking because I would release a blog post with the PoCs in some months.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>I confirmed the DCHECK in v8 version 9.3.0 (git hash: <span class="line"><!---->I confirmed the DCHECK in v8 version 9.3.0 (git hash: <!----></span>d0c0d4c36b24183f65cedcc0c6dd5974fb0634af<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/d0c0d4c36b24183f65cedcc0c6dd5974fb0634af"><!---->d0c0d4c36b24183f65cedcc0c6dd5974fb0634af<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br>and in v8 version 9.1.269.28 (git hash: <span class="line"><!---->and in v8 version 9.1.269.28 (git hash: <!----></span>fd856cebb3515699d942d0f2517f6658a0cf720b<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/fd856cebb3515699d942d0f2517f6658a0cf720b"><!---->fd856cebb3515699d942d0f2517f6658a0cf720b<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br><br>.maximize() Testcase:<span class="line"><!---->.maximize() Testcase:<!----></span><br>var var_3_ = new Intl.Locale("en-US-4106-4104-4102-4100-4098-4096-4094-4092-4090-4088-4086-4084-4082-4080-4078-4076-4074-4072-4070-4068-4066-4064-4062-4060-4058-4056-4054-4052-4050-4048-4049");<span Intl.Locale("en-US-4106-4104-4102-4100-4098-4096-4094-4092-4090-4088-4086-4084-4082-4080-4078-4076-4074-4072-4070-4068-4066-4064-4062-4060-4058-4056-4054-4052-4050-4048-4049");<!----></span><br>var_3_.maximize();<span         Maybe it's useful if I also post here the "double free in tcache bug". This is a different bug to the above one and this PoC just works in v8 9.1.269.28 (and not in  9.3.0), but I don't know if it was fixed yet or if just the PoC must slightly be adapted. Since the PoC is very similar to the above one I'm posting it here (maybe it helps in the analysis or impact analysis):<span class="line"><!---->Maybe it's useful if I also post here the "double free in tcache bug".            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          </chops-button>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->DETAILS<!----></span><br>I found the following PoC during fuzzing. It leads to a DCHECK in a v8 binary compiled with DCHECKS enabled.<span class="line"><!---->I found the following PoC during fuzzing. It leads to a DCHECK in a v8 binary compiled with DCHECKS enabled.<!----></span><br>Since I assume that this is not a security bug I removed the security-tag (I hope I did this correctly).<span class="line"><!---->Since I assume that this is not a security bug I removed the security-tag (I hope I did this correctly).<!----></span><br><br>I would also have another question:<span class="line"><!---->I would also have another question:<!----></span><br>I found during fuzzing three other bugs, however, I couldn't reproduce them in the current v8 9.3.0 - they just affect v8 9.1.269.28 (which is the v8 version used in Chrome 91.0.4472.77).<span class="line"><!---->I found during fuzzing three other bugs, however, I couldn't reproduce them in the current v8 9.3.0 - they just affect v8 9.1.269.28 (which is the v8 version used in Chrome 91.0.4472.77).<!----></span><br>One of them is a "double free detected in tcache" / "double free or corruption", another one is a "abort: 32 bit value in register is not zero-extended" and the third is just a crash with a stack trace. Should I also report these bugs, although I can't reproduce them in the current v8 version? If yes, in just 1 bug report or in 3 bug reports? I'm especially asking because I would release a blog post with the PoCs in some months.<span class="line"><!---->One of them is a "double free detected in tcache" / "double free or corruption", another one is a "abort: 32 bit value in register is not zero-extended" and the third is just a crash with a stack trace. Should I also report these bugs, although I can't reproduce them in the current v8 version? If yes, in just 1 bug report or in 3 bug reports? I'm especially asking because I would release a blog post with the PoCs in some months.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>I confirmed the DCHECK in v8 version 9.3.0 (git hash: <span class="line"><!---->I confirmed the DCHECK in v8 version 9.3.0 (git hash: <!----></span>d0c0d4c36b24183f65cedcc0c6dd5974fb0634af<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         Maybe it's useful if I also post here the "double free in tcache bug". This is a different bug to the above one and this PoC just works in v8 9.1.269.28 (and not in  9.3.0), but I don't know if it was fixed yet or if just the PoC must slightly be adapted. Since the PoC is very similar to the above one I'm posting it here (maybe it helps in the analysis or impact analysis):<span class="line"><!---->Maybe it's useful if I also post here the "double free in tcache bug". This is a different bug to the above one and this PoC just works in v8 9.1.269.28 (and not in  9.3.0), but I don't know if it was fixed yet or if just the PoC must slightly be adapted. Since the PoC is very similar to the above one I'm posting it here (maybe it helps in the analysis or impact analysis):<!----></span><br><br>new Intl.RelativeTimeFormat("en-US-4106-4105-4104-4103-4102-4101-4100-4099-4098-4097-4096-4095-4094-4093-4092-4091-4090-4089-4088-4087-4086-4085-4084-4083-4082-4081-4080-4079-4078-4077ja-u-nu-jpanfin");<span class="line"><!---->new Intl.RelativeTimeFormat("en-US-4106-4105-4104-4103-4102-4101-4100-4099-4098-4097-4096-4095-4094-4093-4092-4091-4090-4089-4088-4087-4086-4085-4084-4083-4082-4081-4080-4079-4078-4077ja-u-nu-jpanfin");<!----></span><br><br>This demonstrates that it's possible to corrupt heap meta data.<span class="line"><!---->Which demonstrates that it's possible to corrupt heap meta data.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by renef...@yahoo.de (Jun 29, 2021)

        Description #1 by renef...@yahoo.de (Jun 29, 2021)

      DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->DETAILS<!----></span><br>I found the following PoC during fuzzing. It leads to a DCHECK in a v8 binary compiled with DCHECKS enabled.<span class="line"><!---->I found the following PoC during fuzzing. It leads to a DCHECK in a v8 binary compiled with DCHECKS enabled.<!----></span><br>Since I assume that this is not a security bug I removed the security-tag (I hope I did this correctly).<span class="line"><!---->Since I assume that this is not a security bug I removed the security-tag (I hope I did this correctly).<!----></span><br><br>I would also have another question:<span class="line"><!---->I would also have another question:<!----></span><br>I found during fuzzing three other bugs, however, I couldn't reproduce them in the current v8 9.3.0 - they just affect v8 9.1.269.28 (which is the v8 version used in Chrome 91.0.4472.77).<span class="line"><!---->I found during fuzzing three other bugs, however, I couldn't reproduce them in the current v8 9.3.0 - they just affect v8 9.1.269.28 (which is the v8 version used in Chrome 91.0.4472.77).<!----></span><br>One of them is a "double free detected in tcache" / "double free or corruption", another one is a "abort: 32 bit value in register is not zero-extended" and the third is just a crash with a stack trace. Should I also report these bugs, although I can't reproduce them in the current v8 version? If yes, in just 1 bug report or in 3 bug reports? I'm especially asking because I would release a blog post with the PoCs in some months.<span class="line"><!---->One of them is a "double free detected in tcache" / "double free or corruption", another one is a "abort: 32 bit value in register is not zero-extended" and the third is just a crash with a stack trace. Should I also report these bugs, although I can't reproduce them in the current v8 version? If yes, in just 1 bug report or in 3 bug reports? I'm especially asking because I would release a blog post with the PoCs in some months.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>I confirmed the DCHECK in v8         Maybe it's useful if I also post here the "double free in tcache bug". This is a different bug to the above one and this PoC just works in v8 9.1.269.28 (and not in  9.3.0), but I don't know if it was fixed yet or if just the PoC must slightly be adapted. Since the PoC is very similar to the above one I'm posting it here (maybe it helps in the analysis or impact analysis):<span class="line"><!---->Maybe it's useful if I also post here the "double free in tcache bug". demonstrates that it's possible to corrupt heap meta data.<span class="line"><!---->Which demonstrates that it's possible to corrupt heap meta data.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Description #1 by renef...@yahoo.de (Jun 29, 2021)

      DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->DETAILS<!----></span><br>I found the following PoC during fuzzing. It leads to a DCHECK in a v8 binary compiled with DCHECKS enabled.<span class="line"><!---->I found the following PoC during fuzzing. It leads to a DCHECK in a v8 binary compiled with DCHECKS enabled.<!----></span><br>Since I assume that this is not a security bug I removed the security-tag (I hope I did this correctly).<span class="line"><!---->Since I assume that this is not a security bug I removed the security-tag (I hope I did this correctly).<!----></span><br><br>I would also have another question:<span class="line"><!---->I would also have another question:<!----></span><br>I found during fuzzing three other bugs, however, I couldn't reproduce them in the current v8 9.3.0 - they just affect v8 9.1.269.28 (which is the v8 version used in Chrome 91.0.4472.77).<span class="line"><!---->I found during fuzzing three other bugs, however, I couldn't reproduce them in the current v8 9.3.0 - they just affect v8 9.1.269.28 (which is the v8 version used in Chrome 91.0.4472.77).<!----></span><br>One of them is a "double free detected in tcache" / "double free or corruption", another one is a "abort: 32 bit value in register is not zero-extended" and the third is just a crash with a stack trace. Should I also report these bugs, although I can't reproduce them in the current v8 version? If yes, in just 1 bug report or in 3 bug reports? I'm especially asking because I would release a blog post with the PoCs in some months.<span class="line"><!---->One of them is a "double free detected in tcache" / "double free or corruption", another one is a "abort: 32 bit value in register is not zero-extended" and the third is just a crash with a stack trace. Should I also report these bugs, although I can't reproduce them in the current v8 version? If yes, in just 1 bug report or in 3 bug reports? I'm especially asking because I would release a blog post with the PoCs in some months.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>I confirmed the DCHECK in v8 version 9.3.0 (git hash: <span class="line"><!---->I confirmed the DCHECK in v8 version 9.3.0 (git hash: <!----></span>d0c0d4c36b24183f65cedcc0c6dd5974fb0634af<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         Maybe it's useful if I also post here the "double free in tcache bug". This is a different bug to the above one and this PoC just works in v8 9.1.269.28 (and not in  9.3.0), but I don't know if it was fixed yet or if just the PoC must slightly be adapted. Since the PoC is very similar to the above one I'm posting it here (maybe it helps in the analysis or impact analysis):<span class="line"><!---->Maybe it's useful if I also post here the "double free in tcache bug". demonstrates that it's possible to corrupt heap meta data.<span class="line"><!---->Which demonstrates that it's possible to corrupt heap meta data.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->DETAILS<!----></span><br>I found the following PoC during fuzzing. It leads to a DCHECK in a v8 binary compiled with DCHECKS enabled.<span class="line"><!---->I found the following PoC during fuzzing. It leads to a DCHECK in a v8 binary compiled with DCHECKS enabled.<!----></span><br>Since I assume that this is not a security bug I removed the security-tag (I hope I did this correctly).<span class="line"><!---->Since I assume that this is not a security bug I removed the security-tag (I hope I did this correctly).<!----></span><br><br>I would also have another question:<span class="line"><!---->I would also have another question:<!----></span><br>I found during fuzzing three other bugs, however, I couldn't reproduce them in the current v8 9.3.0 - they just affect v8 9.1.269.28 (which is the v8 version used in Chrome 91.0.4472.77).<span class="line"><!---->I found during fuzzing three other bugs, however, I couldn't reproduce them in the current v8 9.3.0 - they just affect v8 9.1.269.28 (which is the v8 version used in Chrome 91.0.4472.77).<!----></span><br>One of them is a "double free detected in tcache" / "double free or corruption", another one is a "abort: 32 bit value in register is not zero-extended" and the third is just a crash with a stack trace. Should I also report these bugs, although I can't reproduce them in the current v8 version? If yes, in just 1 bug report or in 3 bug reports? I'm especially asking because I would release a blog post with the PoCs in some months.<span class="line"><!---->One of them is a "double free detected in tcache" / "double free or corruption", another one is a "abort: 32 bit value in register is not zero-extended" and the third is just a crash with a stack trace. Should I also report these bugs, although I can't reproduce them in the current v8 version? If yes, in just 1 bug report or in 3 bug reports? I'm especially asking because I would release a blog post with the PoCs in some months.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>I confirmed the DCHECK in v8 version 9.3.0 (git hash: <span class="line"><!---->I confirmed the DCHECK in v8 version 9.3.0 (git hash: <!----></span>d0c0d4c36b24183f65cedcc0c6dd5974fb0634af<a class="undefined" target="_blank" This is a different bug to the above one and this PoC just works in v8 9.1.269.28 (and not in  9.3.0), but I don't know if it was fixed yet or if just the PoC must slightly be adapted.       DETAILS<span class="line"><!---->DETAILS<!----></span><br>I found the following PoC during fuzzing. It leads to a DCHECK in a v8 binary compiled with DCHECKS enabled.<span class="line"><!---->I found the following PoC during fuzzing. It leads to a DCHECK in a v8 binary compiled with DCHECKS enabled.<!----></span><br>Since I assume that this is not a security bug I removed the security-tag (I hope I did this correctly).<span class="line"><!---->Since I assume that this is not a security bug I removed the security-tag (I hope I did this correctly).<!----></span><br><br>I would also have another question:<span class="line"><!---->I would also have another question:<!----></span><br>I found during fuzzing three other bugs, however, I couldn't reproduce them in the current v8 9.3.0 - they just affect v8 9.1.269.28 (which is the v8 version used in Chrome 91.0.4472.77).<span class="line"><!---->I found during fuzzing three other bugs, however, I couldn't reproduce them in the current v8 9.3.0 - they just affect v8 9.1.269.28 (which is the v8 version used in Chrome 91.0.4472.77).<!----></span><br>One of them is a "double free detected in tcache" / "double free or corruption", another one is a "abort: 32 bit value in register is not zero-extended" and the third is just a crash with a stack trace. Should I also report these bugs, although I can't reproduce them in the current v8 version? If yes, in just 1 bug report or in 3 bug reports? I'm especially asking because I would release a blog post with the PoCs in some months.<span class="line"><!---->One of them is a "double free detected in tcache" / "double free or corruption", another one is a "abort: 32 bit value in register is not zero-extended" and the third is just a crash with a stack trace. Should I also report these bugs, although I can't reproduce them in the current v8 version? If yes, in just 1 bug report or in 3 bug reports? I'm especially asking because I would release a blog post with the PoCs in some months.<!----></span><br><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>I confirmed the DCHECK in v8 version 9.3.0 (git hash: <span class="line"><!---->I confirmed the DCHECK in v8 version 9.3.0 (git hash: <!----></span>d0c0d4c36b24183f65cedcc0c6dd5974fb0634af<a class="undefined" target="_blank" This is a different bug to the above one and this PoC just works in v8 9.1.269.28 (and not in  9.3.0), but I don't know if it was fixed yet or if just the PoC must slightly be adapted.         The report on REPRODUCTION CASE is not a big deal<span class="line"><!---->The report on REPRODUCTION CASE is not a big deal<!----></span><br>The locale is not .minimize() / .maximize() correctly due to <span class="line"><!---->The locale is not .minimize() / .maximize() correctly due to <!----></span>https://unicode-org.atlassian.net/browse/ICU-21639<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://unicode-org.atlassian.net/browse/ICU-21639"><!---->https://unicode-org.atlassian.net/browse/ICU-21639<!----></a> but the DCHECK is not harmful . for release build it is just return the incorrect value (not max nor min) one. DCHECK like this should not be considered as security bug, it is just warning us there are sometime unexpected. (it is indeed incorrect, but not harmful)<span class="line"><!----> but the DCHECK is not harmful . for release build it is just return the incorrect value (not max nor min) one.         for LitElement.

        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
